p: Zika cases were defined as all people with laboratory- confirmed natural circulation of ZIKV two weeks before the onset of symptoms and who presented with rash and one or more of the following signs: fever < 38.5 °C, nonpurulent conjunctivitis or conjunctival hyperemia, arthralgia, myalgia, headache, or general discomfort. Laboratory confirmation included the detection of Zika-specific IgM antibodies in the serum.
